title: Poster, "Couverts Deetjen", 1930
medium: Lithograph on paper, backed on linen
signed: Signed on stone at upper right:  Jean A. Mercier 30
provenance: Louis Bixenman, Poster America, New York
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program and through gift of Lucy Work Hewitt
description: A fork, knife and spoon in gray appear diagonally, from right to left, on a pink and white checked ground (simulating a table cloth).  The words, Deetjen/100 GR, in bright royal blue block letters run diagonally, from left to right, across the flatware in bottom third of poster.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Couverts Deetjen", 1930.
1930. Lithograph on paper, backed on linen. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program and through gift of Lucy Work Hewitt. 1996-8-1.
